location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'Pilger aus Sukapura'. Photographer: Christiaan Snouck Hurgronje

physicalDescription.extent: Dimensions:138 x 98 mmFormat:1 collotype printCondition:The print is in good condition.Foliation:‘XIX’

mods.abstract: Genre/Subject Matter:This full-length seated portrait shows two men, described as [Muslim] pilgrims from Sukapura, an area in modern-day East Java.The man on the right wears a checked jacket over a checked sarong, which may be a form of teluk beskap. He wears a stripe-printed turban on his head, sandals on his feet and across his body is a dark-coloured strap. The man on the left also wears a shirt-jacket and sarong of pale-colour, which may be a teluk beskap, as well as a pale-coloured turban on his head.The negative has had hand-work applied, particularly about the feet.Inscriptions:Printed above image, in ink:XIXPrinted beneath image, in ink:‘Pilger aus Sukapura (Java).’A circular 'British Museum' blind stamp is located in the lower left corner.
